meanings.definition: To assign or credit something to a different source or cause.
meanings.sent1: I will reattribute the success of the project to our hardworking team.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reattribute the discovery to the scientist who first made it.
meanings.sent3: After the mix-up, they had to reattribute the painting to the correct artist.
meanings.sent4: She decided to reattribute her happiness to the little things in life.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to reattribute the crime to the real culprit.

meanings.definition: To attribute something back to its original source or cause.
meanings.sent1: Let's reattribute the idea to its original creator.
meanings.sent2: The historian had to reattribute the ancient artifact to the correct civilization.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to reattribute the disappearing act to his pet rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The author wanted to reattribute the inspiration for the story to her childhood memories.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist had to reattribute the fossil to the correct prehistoric animal.
